answers.author: Ronald Searl
answers.text:
We do not have such a regional policy however we do have an opt out incentive program that employees with coverage through a spouse (for example) can use.  We require that they provide proof of other insurance and we will pay them $4,000 annually to "opt-out" of our coverage.

author: Mark Abeles-Allison
text: Do any communities have a regional policy regarding dual health insurance policies for employees?  For instance do you have an agreement with local school districts that municipal employees would have one policy or the other but not both?  Is this permissible?  What has your community done to try and discourage dual policies?  Thanks.
title: Health Insurance Availability from Spouses
